properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 3 at 1:22PM MST until January 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...VERY STRONG WINDS WILL CREATE GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS
AROUND ARLINGTON THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING...

* WHAT...Ground blizzard conditions expected. After a brief
improvement in visibility this afternoon...they are expected to
lower with increased blowing snow after sunset. Visibilities
under one quarter mile with blowing snow and wind gusts
exceeding 60 mph will create whiteout conditions overnight.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 from Arlington to Elk Mountain.

* WHEN...Through 5 AM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slick and icy road conditions. Widespread
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could make travel difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Follow Wyoming Department of Transportation
Road Condition Report for latest updates on road conditions and
closures.
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: GROUND BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY
